727307f-a.title: Queens: Main Avenue - 8th Street

727302f-a.title: Queens: Main Avenue - Vernon Boulevard
727302f-a.text:
(1)
Main Ave., adjoining the N.W. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing
the Rapelye Mansion. There is a dispute as to its identity. Eugene
L. Armbruster states it is the Cornelius Rapelye house; one Van Rieper
states it to be the Tavern; another, Mr. Roe S. Johnson states that
this was the Trafford house and was also used as a tavern. Eucene W.
Armbruster's history on this subject is that John Trafford married
Grace Rapelye, sister of C. Rapelye, who erected this house in 1780.
It was occupied by C. R. Trafford in 1873.
April 1925.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collectiom.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
727302f-a.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727302f-b.title: Queens: Main Avenue - Vernon Boulevard
727302f-b.text:
(1)
Main Ave., adjoining the N.W. corner of Vernon Boulevard, showing

L. Armbruster states it is the Cornelius Rapelye house; one Van Rieper
states it to be the Tavern; another, Mr. Roe S. Johnson states that

Armbruster's history on this subject is that John Trafford married

It was occupied by C. R. Trafford in 1873.

727302f-b.folder: Main Avenue & Vernon Boulevard, Queens, NY

727303f-b.title: Queens: Main Avenue - Vernon Boulevard
727303f-b.text:
(1)
Main Ave., adjoining the N.1. corner of kernon Boulevard, showing
the Rapelje Mansion, erected in 1780 by JJacobus Riker at 29 Main Street
(old number). This house was occupied by the family for over a hundred
years. It was still standing in October 1934.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, showing the west side of the house.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, showing also the front of the house facing on Main Ave.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
